maybe he means requirements for user story? i.e. done by devs (us)

I will write why we choose MEAN for this project. That is not all that difficult. 


Perhaps, a detail user story would be a detail description of the process of going through that task. I don't know. 

Perhaps something like this 

Detail could be added to that user story example by adding the following conditions of satisfaction:

Make sure it works with major retail holidays: Christmas, Easter, President’s Day, Mother’s Day, Father’s Day, Labor Day, New Year’s Day.
Support holidays that span two calendar years (none span three).
Holiday seasons can be set from one holiday to the next (such as Thanksgiving to Christmas).
Holiday seasons can be set to be a number of days prior to the holiday.
i think these can be added as a checklist under each card
exactly
I have my 3350 notes I'll find what Braico has for detailed user stories

We also need a release plan. Maybe we move what's currently on each card to the top of the description, and have the iteration and a title for each?

Example:

"Itr 1:
Add questions

As a professor, I want to be able to add questions and set up answers.

Cost: x days
..."
yes, that is a great idea. we should do this.

It's basically what we have already. Big user stories are supposed to be general ideas written by users "I want to access class lists" and then detailed stories are written by developers in conjunction with users to give more detail "I need to implement a class list page to access class lists"
I like that idea also
Okay, I'll work on that
im gonna add checklists to user stories that i understand
i dont think we need a separate column for detailed user stories, we can just put them as a checklist under a user story that it relates to
you can write it in a description, as has been suggested
Like the last card in high priority works well
i think Tyler is making new cards, but hes not online
Yeah ok I see what you mean
Feel free to change any of the iteration numbers I'm putting in the titles
if anyone is against color coding priorities, feel free to remove them (red = high, orange =medium, green = low)
Or edit the estimates
I like the colour coding
Once you add all the headings I can add the detailed stories/costs into the comments
Also the bottom high priority story is also the same as location story in the medium column
I think there should be two- one that ensures only people from the class (but not specifically in the classroom) can vote, and one that comes later that ensures that they are in the classroom
So we would just need to change the high priority one to something with logins instead of location
Ah ok
if we force students to log in to vote, we don’t care that much about location, only that its coming from uni

Or not, I dunno
public voting to anyone would be bad

So one for log in, one for location
if anyone with a link can access and vote, probably not something we want
yeah, maybe change user story to create student authentication

I think instant feedback is the one for students to get confirmation their vote was received, like the replacement for the green LED and the other one is for the prof to view the results instantly
There's also feedback with explanation
Feedback with explanation would be displaying the answer to the student once the poll is closed maybe?
The live results is the professor feedback.
Ok we have an extra story then by the looks of it
we have instant feedback card (green LED confirmation) and feedback with explanation (explaining the right answer) in medium user stories
They're all similar but just on different interfaces

attachments.title: nvie/gitflow
attachments.text: gitflow - Git extensions to provide high-level repository operations for Vincent Driessen's branching model.

text: type ```git flow feature start XXX``` where XXX is the feature name
from IDE, press on the Gitflow button and click start feature
follow the pop ups...
cool i see it
it will handle everything for you
and to merge my current branch to develop?
finish feature?
yep
```git flow feature finish XXX```
then ```git push```
to push updated develop
btw you getting any errors on the client side? after i pulled develope getting angularjs errors in console

npm is back end only
